text: Marvyn Cox Marvyn Cox (born 11 July 1964 in Whitstable, Kent) is a former Speedway rider .Oakes, P.(2006). Speedway Star Almanac. Cox was twice a winner of the German Individual Championship in 1993 and 1995 ==Domestic career== Marvyn has ridden for the Rye House Rockets, Hackney Hawks, Oxford Cheetahs, Bradford Dukes and the Poole Pirates. He was part of the Oxford title winning team in 1985 and 1986. ==Overseas career== Marvyn rode in the Swedish Elitserien for Valsarna ==International career== In 1984 he won the European Under 21 Championship after finishing third in 1983. He has represented England in the World Team Cup final twice and featured in two World Championship finals. He was also in the first two seasons of the Speedway Grand Prix series in 1995 and 1996. ==World Final appearances== ===Individual World Championship=== * 1986 - Chorzów, Silesian Stadium - 12th - 3pts * 1994 - Vojens, Speedway Center - 6th - 9pts ===World Team Cup=== * 1986 - Bradford, Odsal Stadium (with Simon Wigg / Kelvin Tatum / Jeremy Doncaster / Chris Morton) - 3rd - 81pts (0) * 1987 - Coventry, Brandon Stadium (with Kelvin Tatum / Jeremy Doncaster / Simon Wigg / Simon Cross) - 2nd - 101pts (2) ==Speedway Grand Prix results== {| class="wikitable" style="font- size: 95%;" |- !
